name: Arkansas Community Dispute Resolution Centers, Inc. (ACDRC)
address: 3805 West 12th Street, Suite 201, Willie L. Hinton Neighborhood Resource Center, Little Rock, AR 72204
description: A non-profit organization offering a wide range of alternative dispute resolution (ADR) services, including mediation, facilitation, conciliation, and arbitration. They serve all Arkansans regardless of their ability to pay

name: Hamlin Dispute Resolution
address: Fayetteville, AR (Specific address not provided in search results)
description: A mediation and arbitration firm with extensive experience in civil litigation, including trucking, commercial, personal injury, and employment disputes. They serve all of Arkansas and surrounding states

name: Midsouth Conflict Solutions
address: Little Rock, AR (Specific address not provided in search results)
description: Offers professional mediation services for both private and organizational disputes, with options for in-person and virtual mediation

name: Arkansas Mediation Services
address: Central Arkansas (Specific address not provided in search results)
description: Provides effective conflict resolution solutions tailored to individual needs, aiming to empower individuals and businesses through mediation for fair and amicable outcomes

name: William H. Bowen School of Law - Mediation Clinic
address: Little Rock, AR (Specific address not provided in search results)
description: Offers mediation services in various areas, with a focus on the Arkansas Special Education and Early Intervention Mediation Projects. Law students gain practical experience while assisting the community

name: Indian Dispute Resolution Services (IDRS, Inc.)
address: Not specified for Arkansas location, but operates nationally
description: While not exclusively in Arkansas, IDRS specializes in conflict resolution and mediation training for American Indian tribes and organizations, with a senior mediator who has extensive experience working with Native leaders

name: American Indian Center of Arkansas (AICA)
description: While AICA focuses on improving the quality of life for Native Americans in Arkansas, they may be able to provide referrals or resources related to mediation services within the Native American community

name: Native Skies Gallery
address: Northwest Arkansas (New location opening soon, current status and address not specified)
description: This is a gallery specializing in Native American art, pottery, and jewelry. While not a mediation service, it is an Indigenous-owned business that supports Native artists and culture. They may be able to offer referrals

name: O-Gah-Pah Coffee
address: Available online, with roots in Arkansas
description: This is a Native-owned coffee company with a connection to Arkansas. While not a mediation service, it represents Indigenous entrepreneurship

name: Arkansas.gov Certified Mediator Directory
description: This is a directory of certified mediators in Arkansas. While not specific to American Indian ownership, it is a resource to find qualified mediators who may be able to assist with disputes. You may need to contact individual mediators to inquire about their affiliations or background
